body: Sometimes the debug connection closes and I have to click again on the Debug button, which triggers a build and an install that can take up to 2 minutes. Can't the plugin see that the App is already running on the emulator and just resync the debug connection instead? Something like an Attach.

comment_data.body:
The debug connection closes randomly, it happens on my desktop pc and also on my laptop. Next time it happens I will try to get some logs. I am just not sure if u can send them, as the bank that I work on has a very strict security policy.

The build time is something I have asked before and suggested ways to avoid it but you guys said it would be rather complicated and would study it... But I was a good while ago... Maybe it's time to revisit it?

PS: This a brand new laptop with an Intel 10th Gen i7 CPU, 16GB RAM and an SSD.

> Sorry, but I'm not sure who best to ask this. Is the team in general happy with the time required to build and install an app? It seems to me that two minutes is quite a long time for that.

Your question prompted me to start digging into this problem at least on iOS, and we can make all steps to build the app skippable when nothing is changed on subsequent builds.  Once that's done, we can implement incremental apps installs with app deltas.  I've documented what I think this will involve at https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/67580#issuecomment-791695934. 
 I've already landed a few pieces of it.

That should bring second/subsequent build times down from minutes to seconds.

I haven't looked into the Android equivalent, but we can at least add some benchmarking to measure how long a second install takes, then start chipping away at it.  See https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/77420

@jmagman that's amazing! Any chance you could dig more into Android? I don't have a Mac here, neither does half of my team, so we are pretty much locked with Android development.

Since Flutter and Android are both Google products, can't we ask the Android team to jump in, and give us some light into this matter?

@feinstein I'm not really familiar with the Android side, this probably warrants an issue filed in [flutter/futter](https://github.com/flutter/flutter).

I did add measurements and a second compilation on Android takes about 30% of the time of the first one, while it's 60% on iOS.
```
$ dart bin/run.dart -t hello_world_ios__compile
...
    "debug_full_compile_millis": 18052,
    "debug_second_compile_millis": 11001
```
```
$ dart bin/run.dart -t hello_world_android__compile
    "debug_full_compile_millis": 15143,
    "debug_second_compile_millis": 4530
```

milestone.description: Issues under consideration for upcoming milestones.
milestone.title: On Deck

title: Sync with running App
